title: 820-00840 not powering on
message:
Was power cycling but after reflowing CD32's power cycling has stopped  
Amp meter shows 5.19v 0.02a
Has had liquid damage in the past as white markers are red.
No signs of corrosion

PPBUS_G3H = 0.09v
PPDCIN_G3H = 5.20v

PPBUS_G3H resistance to ground = 14.52MOhms

I'm thing to replace the CD32's   ???

Thanks in advance

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message:
"PPBUS_G3H resistance to ground = 14.52MOhms"
High value ohm readings don't help.
We need to know more about the power rail, apart of no short.
Use diode mode; only switch to ohm scale for very low values.

Do you get 3V3_G3H?

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message:
I went ahead a replaced both CD32's but problem still persists

3V3_G3H = 3.4v
PPBUS_G3H = 0.28v
PPDCIN_G3H = 5.20v 

PPBUS_G3H = 0.428v diode mode

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message: Check what happens with battery connected (known good battery).

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message: Tried that. Still stuck at 5.19v  0.02a

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message: Was the diode mode reading for ppbus_g3h ok??

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message:
Diode mode looks good.
PPBUS_G3H voltage with battery connected?
Don't forget battery data cable.

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message:
PPBUS_G3H voltage with battery connected = 0.97v

Noticed that PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR_R = 5.20v  but PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H = 4.88v .  Does that sound correct to you???

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message:
You've said to get correct 3V3_G3H, so 4.88V is good there.

Disconnect F7000 and check C7050 voltage.

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message:
With F7000 removed voltage at C7050 = 0v

Bare in mind I only have charger plugged in and not battery

Could it be a bad U2890 Rom chip? Does the ROM chip U2890 W25Q80DVUXIE have to come from a donor or can it be purchased from places like mouser?

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message:
U2890 has the frimware required for CD3215 chips and U2800.
Must come from donor board, or new one flashed with correct file.

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message: What did you work out from the readings I gave you at C7050? Where do I go from here?

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message:
I found a replacement U2890 but it made no difference and besides, I think if it was the ROM I would have power cycling right?
Do you think it could be the HAL sensor or am I just unlucky and the two CD32's I bought new off ebay are crap??

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message:
Should have a problem into U7000 area, as no voltage with battery too.
Post basic U7000 voltages; P_IN, AUX_DET, VDDA/P, SMC_RST*, AUX_OK, A/BMON.

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message:
Are these the readings you asked for? I wasn't to sure.

DP_INT_HPD - 0v
TBA_AUX_DET - 1.29v
TBA_VDDA - 5.13v
TBA_VDDP - 5.13v
SMC_RST_IN - 0v
SMC_RST_BTN_L - 0v
SMC_RST_BTN_R_L - 0v
SMC_AUX_OK - 2.32v
CHGR_AMON - 0v
CHGR_BMON - 0v

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message:
Are these the readings you asked for? I wasn't to sure. These are without battery.

DP_INT_HPD - 0v
TBA_AUX_DET - 1.29v
TBA_VDDA - 5.13v
TBA_VDDP - 5.13v
SMC_RST_IN - 0v
SMC_RST_BTN_L - 0v
SMC_RST_BTN_R_L - 0v
SMC_AUX_OK - 2.32v
CHGR_AMON - 0v
CHGR_BMON - 0v

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message:
"SMC_RST_IN - 0v"
I didn't ask for that one; please read correctly.
I used U7000 internal notations; check the corresponding external ones.

SMC_RESET_L gets steady 3V?

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message:
P_IN (PPDCIN_G3H) - 5.20v
AUX_DET (TBA_AUX_DET) - 1.29v ,
VDDA (TBA_VDDA) - 5.13v
VDDP (TBA_VDDP) - 5.13v 
SMC_RST* (SMC_RESET_R_L) - 0v
AUX_OK (SMC_AUX_OK) - 2.32v 
AMON (CHGR_AMON) - 0v 
BMON (CHGR_BMON) - 0v 

SMC_RESET_L - 0v

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message: Just checked PP3V3_G3H and it's now only showing 2.32v

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message: Reball, or (better) change CD3215 chips.

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message: Waiting for stock. Will get back to you. Thanks

title: 820-00840 not powering on
message: Can a bad CD3215 pull down PP3V3_G3H ?
